description: {"blocks":[{"key":"85t7p","text":"Dissociation of Anopheles sp midgut into a single-cell suspension for scRNAseq ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14anb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtuj8","text":"Here, we develop a method of cold dissociation for the mosquito midgut and salivary gland tissues that results in cell viability and recovery sufficient for scRNA-seq using a cold-activated protease from Bacillus licheniformis isolated from Himalayan glaciers (Adam et al. 2017). Dissociation of fragile tissues at 4-6ºC has the potential to decrease stress-related artefacts compared to 37ºC proteolytic dissociation (Adam et al. 2017; O'Flanagan et al. 2019) . This method enabled us to recover sufficient cells from mosquito salivary gland and midgut tissues for scRNAseq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":260,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":260,"length":18},{"key":2,"offset":418,"length":43}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A2932D4C3DCA11EF8C690A58A9FEAC02","height":268,"id":536799,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"graphical.abstract.090742.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qysh77ue.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/sng977ue.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/sng877ue.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C3B2DDDF49C211EF81960A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://paperpile.com/c/id6jzq/BIeJ"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C3B2DDDF49C211EF81960A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://paperpile.com/c/id6jzq/BIeJ+w09e"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"709if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58kf0","text":"Dissociation will be carry on in chambered slides that allow to handle low volume (\u003c400µL) for the dissociation while being monitoring under a microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1n60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nnkg","text":"NB: The dissociation needs to be visually monitored using a microscope to check the proportion of single cells vs surrounding debris. The use of chambered slides or low-volume culture plates is perfectly on purpose.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":215},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":215}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69mkk","text":"Dissect 10 mosquito guts in a droplet containing Sf900III and transfer on ice. Check under a dissection scope that tissue is not too affected by dissection or had dried. Remove any contaminant tissues surrounding midguts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98knq","text":"Rinse guts and cut into pieces before transferring them gently with forceps in a well that contains   DB. Disrupt pieces of tissue by using a P1000 pipette to pipette up and down 30 times slowly (two seconds up, two seconds down, etc). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2jjfa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i5","text":"The whole dissociation process must not be longer than 90'. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ada0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"588cs","text":"Start the clock when step 3 done.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"AB783C009E7411EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"E6EA5A409E7211EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2utq","text":"NB, prior trituration, tips and needle are primed with the digestion buffer to avoid cell to stick","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":98},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec33e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4imon","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkn49","text":"After   , the tissue suspension is mixed 15 times again using P1000 primed pipette tip with 2s per up or down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"E89DD1979E7311EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2sem1","text":"Repeat step 4. two times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rbah","text":"The dissociation cycle of 30’ (mixing, 20’ of incubation, mixing, 5’ of settling, followed by collection of single cells) is carried out two other times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cni0","text":"The larger pieces of tissue are allowed to settle for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"BFC72AF09E7311EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bht1n","text":"Single-cells are collected from the supernatant by gently removing   of supernatant using a primed P200 pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1f82m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6plv","text":"Single-cells are transferred into a 50mL conical tube containing   of Sf900III on ice and in the dark (this large volume is required to dilute the dissociation buffer). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r071","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","guid":"D0C0C2709E7411EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","guid":"D4AB6A209E7411EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"747fo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h13e","text":"Prepare    of dissociation buffer (DB) per well. Each well must contain 1-20 midguts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8799","text":"Mix    of Bacillus licheniformis protease and    of DNAse1 in Sf900III medium and store on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7i4c3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"246l1","text":"NB: 200µL will be add first in the well, then 3x 100µL. Remaining volume is used to prime tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"750","guid":"DE5870469E7C11EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","concentration":"10","guid":"DE5870C89E7C11EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":204}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"25","concentration":"10","guid":"DE58713C9E7C11EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1242}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9gck","text":"Add   per well of fresh DB to the remaining tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","guid":"7E3178DC9E7511EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iali","text":"At the end of the 90', the remaining tissue from the chambered slides is mixed in 100-200µL of fresh DB with a primed P200 pipette (20 up/down, 3s each) to increase shear force, the remaining cells are transferred to the same collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar54t","text":"Cells are then gently pelleted in the canonical 50mL tube 700g 5-10' at   and the supernatant is removed (but can be saved to check for single-cells) with a serological pipette without disturbing the pellet.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ne4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BB19ABA09E7711EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kgot","text":"Step 4. -\u003e 4.1 -\u003e 4.2 -\u003e 4.3 for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"br93r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"39EC79F09E7611EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kbfh","text":"Repeat on dissociation cycle: Step 4. -\u003e 4.1 -\u003e 4.2 -\u003e 4.3 for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"A847CF259E7611EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbcd","text":"Rinse chamber-slide well with 200µL of cold Sf900III and transferred into the collection tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"86ev","text":"Repeat 6.1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h3up","text":"Cell pellets is resuspended in 200µL-1.5mL of fresh Sf900III, filtered accordingly of the FACS use (40µm) and transferred in a fresh 1.5mL tube, kept at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":153,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fvalc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C5F313409E7711EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"457c7","text":"Cells are washed once with cold SF900III at 500g/4ºC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hdl9","text":"Cells are resuspended in 1mL of Sf900III and stained with a combination of Acridine Orange (AO, 318337 from Merck) at    and Ethidium Homodimer-1 (EthD1, E1169 from ThermoFisher) at   for 5-15’ at   in the dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":118,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":182,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":197,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15tfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p34t","text":"The  AO is a cell-permeable fluorescent dye that will emit a green fluorescence at 525 nm when bound to DNA at neutral pH. It was used as a cell-specific marker in our suspension. Meanwhile, EthD1 is a cell-impermeant dye that binds to DNA and emits red fluorescence (617nm). It was used as a counterstain for dying and dead cells in both fluorescent microscopy and FACS in conjunction with the AO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":398}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e91af","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.5","guid":"991860F09E7711EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","unit":1245}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","guid":"A5D640009E7711EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","unit":1245}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AD28F1E09E7711EAA114D514ABE88A1B","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek913","text":"Cells are washed twice with 1.5ml of Sf900III by centrifugation at 500g,   for 5-10’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3F4B64609E7811EAA2E50A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"246i6","text":"Cells are resuspended in FACS-compatible tubes in 0.4%BSA-SF900III cold media for sorting and store on ice in the dark until the sort or the load for scRNAseq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgrhl","text":"Cell concentration and viability is checked under a fluorescent microscope (or using a automated fluorescent cell counter). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52val","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o2r0","text":"525nm Green for the AO ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjan8","text":"617nm Red for the EthD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d84jh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fvr2","text":"AO+/EthD1-  -\u003e All the healthy cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jijk","text":"AO+/EthD1+ -\u003e Dying cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do2tg","text":"AO-/EthD1+ -\u003e Dead cells  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n1pu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dy0qq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7f2md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cng4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3sh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E12CEA8A344811EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":411,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"f9ctk\",\"text\":\"1 dying cell\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"3qi3f\",\"text\":\"2 cluster of individualised single-cells, are clotted on slide but would be single in flow\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"4pqhj\",\"text\":\"3 nucleus is hardly defined, the whole cell is stained, cell is maybe dying, would be discard by the FSC/SCC gating\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"9v5jq\",\"text\":\"4 dead cell\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"fq087\",\"text\":\"5 high quality cell. Nucleus is well defined and stained compared to the cytoplasm.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/public/2c336c7c6eef0db99f50fb7e668ed7b4f0c1866c9d37ec687dea2325389f214d/b9vi77ue.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/public/2c336c7c6eef0db99f50fb7e668ed7b4f0c1866c9d37ec687dea2325389f214d/b9vh77ue.png","type":1,"width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a59iu","text":"Prepare 1 canonical   tube per well by adding   of Sf900III on ice and in the dark. This tube with this large volume is required to dilute the dissociation buffer when collecting/rescuing the single-cells.
